intro: Cynoglossum erythraeum, commonly known as the Red Dead-nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. Cynoglossum erythraeum is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
